title: 889-E
statement: E. Mod Mod Modtime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou are given a sequence of integersa1,a2, ...,an. Let, andfor1 ≤i<n. Here,denotes the modulus operation. Find the maximum value off(x, 1)over all nonnegative integersx.InputThe first line contains a single integern(1 ≤n≤ 200000) — the length of the sequence.The second lines containsnintegersa1,a2, ...,an(1 ≤ai≤ 1013) — the elements of the sequence.OutputOutput a single integer — the maximum value off(x, 1)over all nonnegative integersx.ExamplesInput210 5Output13Input55 4 3 2 1Output6Input45 10 5 10Output16NoteIn the first example you can choose, for example,x= 19.In the second example you can choose, for example,x= 3orx= 2.

processed.result:
You are given a sequence of integers $a_1, a_2, ..., a_n$.  Let $f(x, 1) = (a_1 \mod x) + (a_2 \mod x) + ... + (a_n \mod x)$ where $\mod$ represents the modulo operation. Find the largest possible value of $f(x, 1)$ for any non-negative integer $x$. 

Input:
* The first line contains an integer $n$ (1 ≤ $n$ ≤ 200000) representing the length of the sequence.
* The second line contains $n$ integers $a_1, a_2, ..., a_n$ (1 ≤ $a_i$ ≤ 10¹³) representing the elements of the sequence.

Output:
* Output a single integer representing the largest possible value of $f(x, 1)$.

You are given a list of numbers.  Find the largest possible result you can get by repeatedly taking the remainder when a number is divided by another number (the "modulus").  The other number can be any non-negative whole number.
